marketContext:
=== MARKET CONTEXT (Twelve Data - Last 24h) ===
RSI (1h): Current 59.4 | 12h Avg: 61.5
MACD (1h): MACD 957.47 | Signal 660.58 | Hist 296.88
Trend: BULLISH
ATR (1h): Current $1323 | 12h Avg: $1436

bugFixes.issue: RSI thresholds too restrictive - RSI 40 for longs and 60 for shorts are not extreme enough for reliable reversals, causing poor entry timing
bugFixes.reasoning: The current RSI thresholds (40 for longs, 60 for shorts) are not extreme enough. With current market RSI at 59.4 (bullish), shorts at RSI 60 are counter-trend and risky. Added momentum confirmation, adjusted thresholds to 35 for longs and 65-68 for shorts (adaptive to trend), and added tolerance to local extreme detection.

bugFixes.issue: Quick exit breakeven threshold too loose - allowing -$5 loss causes many 'breakeven' trades to actually be losses
bugFixes.reasoning: The quick-exit-breakeven logic was allowing trades to exit with up to -$5 loss, which explains why 42 'breakeven' trades only had 33% win rate and many had negative PnL. Changed threshold from pnl >= -5 to pnl >= 0.50 (must be actually profitable). Also added stale trade detection and trailing stop concept.

bugFixes.issue: Duplicate trades being opened - sample shows identical entry/exit prices suggesting duplicate signal processing
bugFixes.reasoning: Sample trades show duplicate entries with identical entry/exit prices (13 anomalies detected). Added lastSignalPrice and lastSignalSide tracking to prevent duplicate signals at similar prices. Also increased MIN_SIGNAL_INTERVAL from 30s to 45s and added MIN_PRICE_CHANGE check.

parameterChanges.reasoning: With ATR at $1323 (1.98% of current price ~$67k), there's enough volatility to capture 0.15% moves. Current take-profit trades are 100% successful, suggesting we can be slightly more aggressive.
Stop losses are causing -$39.49 total loss across 25 trades. Tighter stops will reduce loss per trade. With 20x leverage, 0.25% stop = $3 max loss per $600 position.
Many quick-exit-breakeven trades are actually losses. Giving trades more time (2 min) allows price to move to profit target. Combined with the bug fix requiring actual profit for quick exit.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: Fewer premature exits, better win rate on quick exits

parameterChanges.reasoning: Volume requirement may be too strict, filtering out valid signals. In bullish trending market with positive MACD histogram (296.88), slightly lower volume threshold is acceptable.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: More trade opportunities without sacrificing quality

parameterChanges.reasoning: Hourly data shows best performance at hours 2,3,8,9 UTC. Reducing max trades forces more selectivity. Current 98 trades in ~12 hours = 8/hour avg, so 15 is still generous.
With $600 position size (30 collateral x 20 leverage), $20 min profit requires 3.3% move which is unrealistic for scalping. $12 = 2% move is more achievable.
parameterChanges.expectedImpact: More trades hitting min profit target

result.summary: Identified 3 critical bugs: 1) RSI thresholds too loose causing poor entry timing especially for shorts in bullish market, 2) Quick-exit-breakeven allowing -$5 losses to count as 'breakeven', 3) Duplicate signal processing causing 13 identical entry/exit trades. Fixed all three with improved signal validation, proper profit requirements for quick exits, and duplicate detection. Parameter changes focus on tighter stops (0.25%), higher take profit (0.15%), and reduced volume requirement (1.5x) to adapt to current bullish market conditions.
result.marketAdaptation: Current market shows RSI 59.4 (bullish), positive MACD histogram (296.88), and ATR of $1323. Strategy adapted by: 1) Raising short RSI threshold to 65-68 in uptrends to avoid counter-trend shorts, 2) Keeping long RSI at 35 for quality dip-buying opportunities, 3) Increasing take profit to 0.15% to capture more of the available volatility, 4) Adding momentum confirmation to ensure we're not fighting the trend.
warnings: Hours 10-14 UTC show consistent losses - consider adding time-based filtering to avoid these hours
7 consecutive losses detected - the pause mechanism should trigger but verify it's working
Short trades in bullish market are inherently riskier - monitor short win rate separately
Watch for market regime change if RSI drops below 50 or MACD histogram turns negative

bugFixesApplied: src/strategy/reversal-strategy.ts: RSI thresholds too restrictive - RSI 40 for longs and 60 for shorts are not extreme enough for reliable reversals, causing poor entry timing
src/risk/recovery-manager.ts: Quick exit breakeven threshold too loose - allowing -$5 loss causes many 'breakeven' trades to actually be losses
src/agent.ts: Duplicate trades being opened - sample shows identical entry/exit prices suggesting duplicate signal processing
